shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Täʾamrä Maryam “Miracles of Mary" (fols. 3ra-183rb) I-1a) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah (fols. 3ra-8rb) I-1b) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah (fol. 10ra-14rb) I-2) ʾƎsäggǝd läki wä-ʾǝweddǝsäki ... “I worship Thee ...” and hymns (fols. 14rb-15rb) I-3a) Introductory exhortation and hymns (fols. 15va-18ra) I-3b) Introductory exhortation and hymns (fols. 19r a-20rb) I-4) Täʾamrä Maryam “Miracles of Mary”: 123+4 miracles (fols. 20va-176va), incomplete? I-5) ʾAkkonu bǝʾǝsi... "Does not the man..." (fols. 177ra-181rb) I-6) Bä-ʾakkwätetä lä-ʾab wä-wäld wä-mänfäs qǝddus ʾǝwäṭṭǝn ṣǝḥifä täʾamriha … “Glorifying the father and the son and the holy spirit I begin to write her miracles …” (fol. 183ra-rb)
Additiones 1-7, colophon.

nmcopyists.nmcopyist: Täwälädä Mädḫǝn (hand a). Ḫaylä Maryam (hand b).

copyists.copyist: Täwälädä Mädḫǝn is mentioned as the scribe in the subscriptio on fol. 181rb (erased but legible). Quire II is written in the same hand as Ms. BMQM-004 (the scribe Ḫaylä Maryam).

donors.donor: The name of the original donors have been erased throughout the Ms. and often crudely replaced with that of Qǝddǝstä Krǝstos and Täsfa Mikaʾel (see also Additio 6). Besides, many other names have been added in the same more recent hand: Wälättä Dǝngǝl (fol. 23rb), Wälättä Qal (fols. 24va, 25vb), Wäldä Krǝstos (fol. 26va), and others The name of Wäldä Śǝllase is written in the supplication formula on fol. 15vb, in hand b.

dcomments.dcomment: According to the colophon, the Ms. was written in 250 year of mercy (= 1674 A.D.). It could be dated back also to 1598 A.D. (if the date is calculated according to the cicle of martyrs); this earlier date would better match the palaeographic features attested for hand a. Quire II is of much more recent time (first half of the 20th cent., cp. dated Ms. BMQM-004 written by the same hand). Fols. 90 and 91 (with miniatures), originating from a different codex (?), probably date back to the 17th cent.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. shows traces of extensive use and was rebound. Quires II was added later. The bifolio with the miniature (fols. 90-91) might orginate from a different codex. The Ms. seems to be incomplete as in Text I-4 the miracles are numbered until 123 whereas 134 miracles are mentioned in the subscriptio on fol. 181rb. Fol. 18 was cut, only the portion with the text is preserved. Fol. 145 was added later, sewn onto the stub of fol. 138 (quire XIX). Holes or tears amended on fols. 12, 51, 54, 99, 116, 123, 148, 159, 164, 167, 168.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather (for the most part hidden under the secondary textile cover); textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish brown leather (at least four tools were used: double line fillet, double circle, x-form, cross hatching).

inks.ink: Black, red (hand a: vivid red and strong red, hand b: strong crimson, hand c: vivid red, hand d: strong red).

squires.squire:
A(1; s.l.: 1, stub after 1/fols. 1rv) – I(8/fols. 2r-9v) – <፩II(9; s.l.: 9, stub before 1/fols. 10r-18v)> – III(8/fol. 19r-26v) – IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – V(8/fols. 35r-42v) – VI(7; s.l.: 2, stub after 6/fols. 43r-49v) – VII(8/fols. 50r-57v) – VIII(7; s.l.: 3, stub after 5/fols. 58r-64v) – IX(8/fols. 65r-72v) – X(8/fols. 73r-80v) – XI(8/fols. 81r-88v) – <XII(4/fols. 89r-92v)> – XIII(8/fol. 93r-100v) – XIV(7; s.l.: 3, stub after 5/fols. 101r-107v) – XV(8/fols. 108r-115v) – XVI(8/fols. 116r-123v) – XVII(6/fols. 124r-129v) – XVIII(8/fols. 130r-137v) – XIX(8; s.l.: 1, stub after 7; 8, no stub /fols. 138r-145v) – XX(8/fols. 146r-153v) – XXI(8/fols. 154r-161v) – XXII(8/fols. 162-169v) – XXIII(7; s.l.: 3, stub after 5/fol. 170r-176v) – XXIV(6/fols. 177r-182v) – XXV(4/fols. 183r-186v)
Fol. 145 is sewn onto the stub of fol. 138 (quire XIX).

taunit.mr-info: Quires: I, III-XXV: all data for fol. 4r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/A. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Quire: II: all data for fol. 11r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/A. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: Hand a: Second half of the 16th cent; b: first half of the 20th cent.; c: second half of the 18th cent. (?); d: 20th cent.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: fine but somewhat irregular. Hand b, c, d: mediocre.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a, Täwälädä Mädḫǝn: Texts I-a, I-3b, I-4, I-5, I-6 (quires I, III-XXV). The handwriting appears irregular throughout the Ms. and changes from careful and neat with slender, broadly spaced and right-sloping letters (quires I, XIV-XXIV) to mediocre resulting in an uneven script with irregularly slanted letters (quires III-XIII). Probably the text was written at several stages. Hand b, Ḫaylä Maryam: quire II (Texts I-b, I-2a and I-3a), recent. Hand c: fols. 89r, 92v (two added miracles of Mary). Hand d: fols. 144ra-145vb (two added miracles of Mary).

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; names of the donors (erased); the words sälam “salutation” and hale luya in Text I-1a, elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.
Several groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I-1a, I-1b, I-3b, I-4, I-5 and I-6, alternating with black lines; several groups of lines in the incipit of Text I-2, alternating with black lines; two initial lines in the incipit of Text I-3a; groups of lines on the incipit page of sections of Texts I-1b and I-3a alternating with black lines; two initial lines of the sections of Texts I-1a and I-4 (sometimes alternating with black lines) and its section numbers; first word of each strophe of Text I-5.

otherdetails.otherdetail:
The miracles of St. Mary (Text I-4) are numbered. Text I-5 comprises 33 strophes which are strophes 1-31, 33-34 according to GrohHymn pp. 336-53.
Text I-5 is followed by a subscriptio stating the number of stophes of Text I-5 (33) and of the miracles of Text I-4 (134): ተፈጸመ፡ በዝየ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለማርያም፡ ዝውእቱ፡ አኮኑ፡ ብእሲ፡ ፴፫፡ ወኵሉ፡ ድሙር፡ ፻ወ፴፬። …

colophon.col: Fols. 181va-182ra: ተፈጸመት፡ ዘቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ በ፪፻ወ፶፡ ዓመተ ምሕረት፡ <…>በመዋዕሊሆሙ፡ <…> ዘነበረ፡ እንዘ፡ ይብል፡ …
colophon.det: Several lines of the extensive colophon have been erased. The writing of the Ms. was completed in 250 year of mercy (= 1598 A.D. or 1674 A.D., cp. ChChron 166,167).

additional.cont: Fol. 1r: Unclear note.
additional.det: The note is written in Amharic, in pencil.

additional.cont: Fol. 1r: Unclear note.
additional.det: The note is written in Amharic, in the same hand that wrote Additio 1, in pencil.

additional.cont: Fol. 8va: Sälam läki ḫoḫətä məśraq... "Salutation to you, Threshold of the East…".
Fol. 89va: Unclear note.

additional.det: According to this note, the Ms. was donated during the time of King ʾIyoʾas (r. 1755-69) and Metropolitan Yoḥannǝs III (in tenure 1745-1761). The name of the donors have been erased.

The beginning of the note is written over erasure. It mentions Qǝddǝstä Krǝstos and Täsfa Mikaʾel as donors, written in the same, more recent hand that inserted those and other names to supplication formulas. The note states that the book was taken by "violent people" after its donation to Ṣäbäla Maryam, then bought back and again given to the monastery during the tenure of ʾǝṗis qoṗos (?) Wäldä Krǝstos, ʾabunä Wäldä Giyorgis and ʾabunä Mäzgäbä Śǝllase.

additional.cont: Fol. 183va-vb: Record concerning commemoration of some individuals (?)

extras.extra: - Sketch for an ornamental band on fol. 183ra. - Corrections written over erasures (hand a): fols. 7ra, 29ra, 42ra, 73ra, 76ra, 77rb, 100vb, 121ra, 137ra, 142ra, 151rb, 159vb (linger passage), 162vb. - Omitted letters or words inserted interlineally (hand b): e.g., fols. 12rb, 13va, 17ra, 18va, - An extensive passage (incipit of the 111th miracle) has been erased from fol. 161rb. - Writing exercises: fols. 9va, 11r, 183r, 183v, 186r (with an ornamental band) - Crude note, in pencil on fol. 182v. - Scribbles on fol. 34r.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Undecorated quire mark written in the inter column of the upper ruled line: fols. 10r: ፩ (hand b).

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Readings are indicated by the names of the feasts crudely written in the upper margin, in pen, in a recent hand: fols. 130va, 145r.

miniature.info: Fol. 90v: St. George slaying the dragon.
miniature.details: Legend: ቅዱስ ፡ ጊዮርጊስ ፡ “Saint George”. Painted on unruled leaf. The folio is of different size and colour and originates from a different older codex.

miniature.info: Fol. 91r: The Virgin and Child with the archangels Michael and Gabriel.
miniature.details: Legend: ሚካኤል፡ “Michael”. ስዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ “Image of our lady Mary with her beloved Son”. ገብርኤል፡ “Gabriel”. Painted on unruled leaf. The folio is of different size and colour and originates from a different older codex.

frames.frame: Fol. 20rb: (explicit of Text I-2b): coloured (red in black) ornamental band; geometric motifs.
